answers.answer: Hi,How are you?Tingling in the fingers shoulders and arms indicates a nerve compression. This nerve compression could be at the level of the cervical region.Another cause can be diabetes and B12 and B6 deficiency. Both these conditions can cause peripheral neuropathies.Excessive anxiety, fatigue and stress can also cause tingling sensations.An X ray or CT scan of neck will help in making the diagnosis of nerve compression.Hope this helps!

question: I have tingling in all 5 fingers of my left hand and feels like a balloon.  Numbness travels up my arm to my shoulder area and upper left quadrent and behind my left ear.  Have have electric and needle test for nerve problems with negative findings.
title: Tingling
